meanings.definition: Charleys: plural noun, informal term for police officers.
meanings.sent1: The charleys patrolled the neighborhood to keep everyone safe.
meanings.sent2: I saw the charleys directing traffic during the parade.
meanings.sent3: The charleys were called to investigate the missing cat.
meanings.sent4: The charleys arrived just in time to stop the robbery.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the charleys' sirens filled the air as they rushed to the scene.

meanings.definition: Charleys: verb, to deceive or trick someone.
meanings.sent1: He tried to charleys his friends into believing he had superpowers.
meanings.sent2: She charleysed her way out of doing her chores by pretending to be sick.
meanings.sent3: The magician used sleight of hand to charleys the audience.
meanings.sent4: The con artist charleysed the old lady out of her life savings.
meanings.sent5: Don't let anyone charleys you into buying something you don't need.

meanings.definition: Charleys: adjective, used to describe something that is fake or counterfeit.
meanings.sent1: She bought a charleys purse that fell apart after a week.
meanings.sent2: The charleys watch stopped working after just a few days.
meanings.sent3: He tried to sell me a charleys painting claiming it was an original.
meanings.sent4: The charleys jewelry turned out to be made of plastic.
meanings.sent5: The charleys designer handbag looked real but was actually a knockoff.
